title: Citi Brings Together 17 Latin American Entrepreneurs in Bogota
summary: Bogotá - As part of the commemoration of Citi's 100th anniversary in Colombia, the bank chose this country to host the IV Latin American Meeting of Entrepreneurs. The event, which brought 17 winners of the bank's annual Microentrepreneurship Awards from 12 countries in the region, took place in Bogotá and provided training designed to help them strengthen their businesses.
tag-1: Citi Brings Together 17 Latin American Entrepreneurs in Bogota
tag-2: Bogotá – As part of the commemoration of Citi's 100th anniversary in Colombia, the bank chose this country to host the IV Latin American Meeting of Entrepreneurs. The event, which brought 17 winners of the bank's annual Microentrepreneurship Awards from 12 countries in the region, took place in Bogotá and provided training designed to help them strengthen their businesses.
tag-3: Award winners from Argentina, Brazil, Colombia, Costa Rica, Ecuador, El Salvador, Guatemala, Mexico, Panama, Paraguay, Peru and the Dominican Republic gathered in the Colombian capital on November 22 through 25 to participate in a specialized training program focusing on areas such as empowerment, sustainable production, trends in business technology, neuromarketing and internationalization.
tag-4: "The Citi Foundation works with local partners to present the Citi Microentrepreneurship Awards every year to promote economic empowerment for entrepreneurs whose business ideas generate progress in their communities," remarked Jennifer Smith, Government Affairs & Corporate Citizenship Head, Citi Latin America.
tag-5: "Year after year, the Citi Microentrepreneurship Awards brings together public- and private-sector actors key to the development of microfinance in Colombia," explained Juliana Alvarez, Director, Banca de las Oportunidades. "These synergies facilitate the exchange of knowledge and, even more important, bring us closer to the direct beneficiaries of these financial instruments and their personal stories and businesses, which serve as examples of how to use microloans successfully."
tag-6: "This Latin American Meeting of Entrepreneurs, which coincides with the commemoration of Citi's first 100 years in Colombia, is part of our bank's commitment to progress in the country's where it has a presence, and of the work we do hand in hand with our partner organizations to strengthen the region's microfinance ecosystem," added Bernardo Chacín, Citi Country Officer for Colombia and Andean Region Head.
tag-7: Over the years, Citi Colombia has benefited more than 100 Colombian microentrepreneurs through the awards. Five of them participated in the IV Latin American Meeting of Citi Microentrepreneurship Award Winners:
tag-8: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.

tag-10: Citi Foundation The Citi Foundation works to promote economic progress in communities around the world and focuses on initiatives that expand financial inclusion. tag-11: Emprender Emprender is a second-tier cooperative specializing for more than 20 years in supporting the development of the microfinance sector in Colombia. It focuses its efforts on five specific areas: first- and second-tier financial intermediation; technological support within the industry; social responsibility; and sector-specific research.
